storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to perform employee schedule management to achieve optimal staffing.

functional.title: Verify successful employee assignment to shift using template
preconditions: User is logged in with Administrator role and has schedule management permissions
At least one shift template exists in the system (e.g., 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM')
At least 3 active employees are available in the system with no existing shift assignments
Employee schedule management page is accessible at /admin/schedule-management
Database EmployeeSchedules table is accessible and has no conflicting records

steps.action: Navigate to /admin/schedule-management page by clicking 'Schedule Management' in the admin navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Employee schedule management interface loads successfully showing calendar view, available templates dropdown, and employee list panel

steps.action: Click on the 'Select Template' dropdown and select 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' template from the list
steps.expectedResult: Template is selected and highlighted, shift details (time, duration, requirements) are displayed in the template preview section

steps.action: From the available employees list, drag and drop employee 'John Smith' onto the selected shift time slot in the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Employee 'John Smith' appears in the shift slot with visual confirmation (employee name, avatar), no error messages displayed

steps.action: Click the 'Save Schedule' button located in the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Green success banner appears at top of page with message 'Schedule saved successfully. 1 employee assigned.' Calendar updates to show saved state with checkmark icon

steps.action: Verify the assignment by refreshing the page and checking the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads and employee 'John Smith' remains assigned to the Morning Shift slot, data persists correctly

postconditions: Employee 'John Smith' is successfully assigned to the Morning Shift in EmployeeSchedules table with status 'active'
Administrator remains on the schedule management page with saved schedule displayed
Employee 'John Smith' can view the assigned shift in their employee portal in real-time
Audit log records the schedule assignment with timestamp and administrator details

functional.title: Verify calendar format displays schedules correctly for multiple employees
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator with schedule management permissions
At least 5 employees are assigned to various shifts across a 7-day period
Calendar view is set to weekly display mode
Browser viewport is at least 1024px width for proper calendar rendering

steps.action: Navigate to the employee schedule management page at /admin/schedule-management
steps.expectedResult: Page loads with calendar view showing current week, days of week as column headers, time slots as rows, and assigned employees visible in respective slots

steps.action: Observe the calendar layout and verify all assigned employees are displayed with their names, shift times, and color-coded indicators
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows all 5 employees in their respective time slots, each with distinct color coding, employee name clearly visible, shift duration accurately represented

steps.action: Click on the 'Next Week' navigation arrow button to view the following week's schedule
steps.expectedResult: Calendar transitions smoothly to next week view, date range updates in header, any assignments for next week are displayed correctly

steps.action: Click on an assigned employee card in the calendar to view detailed shift information
steps.expectedResult: Modal or side panel opens showing detailed information: employee name, shift template used, start/end times, break times, and any notes

postconditions: Calendar view accurately reflects all schedule data from EmployeeSchedules table
Administrator remains on schedule management page with calendar view active
No data is modified during view-only operations
Calendar state (selected week) is maintained in session storage

functional.title: Verify administrator can make adjustments to existing employee assignments
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator with edit permissions
Employee 'Jane Doe' is already assigned to 'Evening Shift 4PM-12AM' on Monday
Employee 'Mike Johnson' is available and not assigned to any shift on Monday
Schedule management page is loaded with current week view displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management page and locate 'Jane Doe' assigned to Monday Evening Shift
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays 'Jane Doe' in the Monday Evening Shift slot with edit controls visible on hover

steps.action: Click on 'Jane Doe' assignment card and select 'Remove Assignment' from the context menu
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure you want to remove Jane Doe from this shift?', with 'Confirm' and 'Cancel' buttons

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' button in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Jane Doe is removed from the shift slot, slot shows as empty/available, visual indicator shows unsaved changes (orange border or asterisk)

steps.action: Drag and drop 'Mike Johnson' from the available employees list to the now-empty Monday Evening Shift slot
steps.expectedResult: 'Mike Johnson' appears in the shift slot, assignment is highlighted as new/modified with visual indicator

steps.action: Click 'Save Schedule' button to persist the changes
steps.expectedResult: Green success message displays 'Schedule updated successfully. 1 assignment modified.' Changes are saved and visual indicators for unsaved changes disappear

postconditions: EmployeeSchedules table is updated: Jane Doe's assignment is removed or marked inactive, Mike Johnson is assigned to Monday Evening Shift
Both Jane Doe and Mike Johnson see updated schedules in their employee portals immediately
Administrator remains on schedule management page with updated calendar view
Change history is logged with details of the modification, timestamp, and administrator ID

functional.title: Verify employees can view their assigned shifts in real-time after administrator saves schedule
preconditions: Administrator is logged in and on schedule management page
Employee 'Sarah Williams' is logged in on a separate browser/device viewing employee portal at /employee/my-schedule
Sarah Williams has no current shift assignments
Real-time update mechanism (WebSocket or polling) is active and functional

steps.action: As Administrator, select 'Day Shift 9AM-5PM' template and assign 'Sarah Williams' to Wednesday Day Shift
steps.expectedResult: Sarah Williams appears in the Wednesday Day Shift slot in administrator's calendar view

steps.action: As Administrator, click 'Save Schedule' button to persist the assignment
steps.expectedResult: Success message 'Schedule saved successfully' appears, assignment is saved to database

steps.action: As Employee Sarah Williams, observe the employee portal schedule view without manually refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: Within 3-5 seconds, the Wednesday Day Shift 9AM-5PM appears in Sarah's schedule view with notification badge or toast message 'New shift assigned'

steps.action: As Employee Sarah Williams, click on the newly assigned shift to view details
steps.expectedResult: Shift details modal opens showing: Date (Wednesday), Time (9AM-5PM), Location, Supervisor name, and any special instructions

postconditions: Sarah Williams' schedule in employee portal accurately reflects the assignment made by administrator
Assignment is stored in EmployeeSchedules table with correct employee ID and shift details
Real-time notification was delivered to employee within acceptable latency (under 5 seconds)
Both administrator and employee views show consistent schedule data

functional.title: Verify bulk assignment of multiple employees to multiple shifts using template
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator with bulk assignment permissions
At least 10 employees are available and unassigned in the system
Multiple shift templates exist: Morning, Afternoon, Evening, Night shifts
Schedule management page supports multi-select functionality

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page and click 'Bulk Assignment' button in the toolbar
steps.expectedResult: Bulk assignment modal opens with options to select multiple employees, date range, and shift template

steps.action: Select 5 employees using checkboxes: John Smith, Jane Doe, Mike Johnson, Sarah Williams, Tom Brown
steps.expectedResult: All 5 employees are highlighted with checkmarks, selected count shows '5 employees selected' at bottom of modal

steps.action: Select date range 'Monday to Friday' using the date picker, and choose 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' template from dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Date range displays 'Mon 01/15 - Fri 01/19', template shows 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' with shift details preview

steps.action: Click 'Apply Bulk Assignment' button at bottom of modal
steps.expectedResult: Progress indicator shows assignment in progress, then success message 'Successfully assigned 5 employees to 5 shifts (25 total assignments)' appears

steps.action: Close modal and verify calendar view shows all 5 employees assigned to Morning Shift for Monday through Friday
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays all 25 assignments correctly, each employee appears in Morning Shift slot for each weekday, no overlaps or errors

postconditions: EmployeeSchedules table contains 25 new records (5 employees × 5 days) with correct shift details
All 5 employees can view their full week schedule in employee portal
Administrator remains on schedule management page with updated calendar showing all assignments
System performance remains acceptable (page load under 2 seconds) after bulk assignment

functional.title: Verify schedule filtering and search functionality for large employee base
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
System contains at least 100 employees with various shift assignments
Schedule management page has search and filter controls visible
Test data includes employees from different departments: Sales, Support, Operations

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page and locate the search bar at top of employee list panel
steps.expectedResult: Search bar is visible with placeholder text 'Search employees by name or ID', filter dropdown shows 'All Departments'

steps.action: Type 'John' in the search bar and observe real-time filtering
steps.expectedResult: Employee list filters in real-time showing only employees with 'John' in their name (e.g., John Smith, Johnny Walker), count shows 'X results found'

steps.action: Clear search and click 'Filter by Department' dropdown, select 'Sales' department
steps.expectedResult: Employee list updates to show only Sales department employees, calendar view updates to show only Sales employees' shifts

steps.action: Click 'Filter by Shift' dropdown and select 'Morning Shift' to further refine results
steps.expectedResult: View narrows to show only Sales employees assigned to Morning Shifts, calendar highlights matching shifts, filter tags appear showing active filters

steps.action: Click 'Clear All Filters' button to reset view
steps.expectedResult: All filters are removed, full employee list is restored, calendar shows all shifts for all employees, filter tags disappear

postconditions: Search and filter functionality works without modifying any schedule data
Administrator remains on schedule management page with default view restored
Filter state is cleared and not persisted in session
Page performance remains acceptable with filtered results loading under 1 second

negative.title: Verify system prevents double-booking employee to overlapping shifts
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Employee 'John Smith' is already assigned to 'Morning Shift 8AM-4PM' on Monday
Another shift template 'Extended Morning 7AM-3PM' exists that overlaps with the existing assignment
Schedule management page is loaded with current week view

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page and verify John Smith is assigned to Monday Morning Shift 8AM-4PM
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows John Smith in Monday 8AM-4PM slot with active assignment indicator

steps.action: Select 'Extended Morning 7AM-3PM' template and attempt to drag John Smith to Monday 7AM-3PM slot
steps.expectedResult: System prevents the drop action, red error indicator appears on the slot, tooltip shows 'Cannot assign: Employee has overlapping shift 8AM-4PM'

steps.action: Attempt to force assignment by clicking 'Assign Employee' button and selecting John Smith from dropdown for the 7AM-3PM slot
steps.expectedResult: Error modal appears with message 'Assignment Conflict: John Smith is already assigned to a shift from 8AM-4PM on Monday. Please remove existing assignment first.' with 'OK' button

steps.action: Click 'OK' to dismiss error modal and attempt to click 'Save Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Save button remains disabled or clicking it shows validation error 'Cannot save: Schedule contains conflicts. Please resolve all conflicts before saving.'

postconditions: No double-booking is created in EmployeeSchedules table, John Smith remains assigned only to 8AM-4PM shift
Administrator remains on schedule management page with error message visible
Original schedule assignment remains unchanged and valid
Validation error is logged in system error log with conflict details

negative.title: Verify unauthorized user cannot access schedule management functionality
preconditions: User is logged in with 'Employee' role (non-administrator)
Employee role does not have schedule management permissions in the system
Schedule management page URL is /admin/schedule-management
Authorization middleware is active and enforcing role-based access control

steps.action: As Employee user, attempt to navigate directly to /admin/schedule-management by typing URL in browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Page redirects to /unauthorized or /access-denied page with error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to access this page. Contact your administrator.'

steps.action: Attempt to access schedule management API endpoint directly by sending POST request to /api/employee-schedules with valid schedule data
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with JSON response: {"error": "Unauthorized", "message": "Insufficient permissions to manage schedules"}

steps.action: Check if schedule management menu item or button is visible in the employee's navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management option is not visible in navigation menu, only employee-accessible options are shown (My Schedule, Time Off, Profile)

postconditions: No schedule data is modified or accessed by unauthorized user
User remains on unauthorized/access denied page or is redirected to their dashboard
Security event is logged with user ID, attempted action, and timestamp
Session remains valid but access attempt is blocked

negative.title: Verify system handles assignment of inactive or terminated employee gracefully
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Employee 'Mark Davis' exists in system with status 'Terminated' or 'Inactive'
Schedule management page is loaded
System should filter out inactive employees from assignment pool

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page and check the available employees list
steps.expectedResult: Available employees list shows only active employees, 'Mark Davis' (terminated) is not visible in the list

steps.action: Attempt to assign terminated employee by directly calling API: POST /api/employee-schedules with Mark Davis's employee ID
steps.expectedResult: API returns 400 Bad Request with error message: {"error": "Invalid Employee", "message": "Cannot assign inactive or terminated employee to shift"}

steps.action: If Mark Davis was previously assigned before termination, attempt to view his existing assignments in the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Past assignments show with visual indicator (grayed out or strikethrough) and label 'Employee Inactive', cannot be edited or extended

postconditions: No new assignments are created for terminated employee in EmployeeSchedules table
System maintains data integrity by preventing invalid assignments
Administrator remains on schedule management page with appropriate error feedback
Existing historical assignments remain viewable but marked as inactive

negative.title: Verify system handles network failure during schedule save operation
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Multiple employees are assigned to shifts with unsaved changes indicated
Browser developer tools are open to simulate network conditions
At least 3 new assignments are pending save

steps.action: Make 3 new employee assignments to various shifts in the calendar view
steps.expectedResult: Assignments appear in calendar with 'unsaved changes' indicator (orange border or asterisk), save button is enabled

steps.action: Open browser developer tools, go to Network tab, and set network throttling to 'Offline' mode
steps.expectedResult: Network is disabled, browser shows offline indicator

steps.action: Click 'Save Schedule' button to attempt saving the assignments
steps.expectedResult: Loading spinner appears briefly, then error message displays: 'Network Error: Unable to save schedule. Please check your connection and try again.' Save button remains enabled for retry

steps.action: Re-enable network connection and click 'Save Schedule' button again
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saves successfully, success message appears: 'Schedule saved successfully. 3 employees assigned.', unsaved changes indicators disappear

postconditions: Assignments are saved to EmployeeSchedules table only after successful network request
No partial or corrupted data is saved during network failure
Administrator remains on schedule management page with all unsaved changes preserved during failure
Error is logged with network failure details and timestamp

negative.title: Verify system prevents assignment when shift template is deleted or invalid
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Shift template 'Night Shift 12AM-8AM' exists and is selected
Another administrator deletes the 'Night Shift' template in a separate session
Schedule management page is open with the now-deleted template selected

steps.action: With 'Night Shift 12AM-8AM' template selected, attempt to assign employee 'Lisa Anderson' to Tuesday night shift
steps.expectedResult: Assignment appears to succeed in UI, employee is placed in the shift slot

steps.action: Click 'Save Schedule' button to persist the assignment
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears: 'Save Failed: The selected shift template no longer exists. Please refresh the page and select a valid template.' Assignment is not saved

steps.action: Refresh the page to reload available templates
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads, 'Night Shift 12AM-8AM' is no longer in the templates dropdown, unsaved assignment is cleared, warning message shows 'Some templates have been removed. Please review your schedule.'

postconditions: No assignment is created in EmployeeSchedules table with invalid template reference
Administrator is prompted to refresh and select valid template
Data integrity is maintained by preventing orphaned template references
Error is logged with details of deleted template and attempted assignment

negative.title: Verify system handles concurrent editing conflicts between multiple administrators
preconditions: Two administrators (Admin A and Admin B) are logged in on separate browsers/devices
Both administrators have the same schedule week open in schedule management page
Employee 'Robert Taylor' is unassigned and available
System implements optimistic locking or conflict detection mechanism

steps.action: Admin A assigns 'Robert Taylor' to Monday Morning Shift 8AM-4PM but does not save yet
steps.expectedResult: Assignment appears in Admin A's calendar view with unsaved indicator

steps.action: Admin B assigns 'Robert Taylor' to Monday Afternoon Shift 12PM-8PM and clicks 'Save Schedule' immediately
steps.expectedResult: Admin B's assignment saves successfully, success message appears, Robert Taylor is assigned to Afternoon Shift in database

steps.action: Admin A now clicks 'Save Schedule' to save their Morning Shift assignment for Robert Taylor
steps.expectedResult: Conflict error appears: 'Conflict Detected: Robert Taylor has been assigned to another shift by another administrator. Please refresh to see current schedule.' Save is blocked

steps.action: Admin A clicks 'Refresh' button or reloads the page
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads showing Robert Taylor assigned to Afternoon Shift (Admin B's assignment), Admin A's unsaved Morning Shift assignment is cleared

postconditions: Only Admin B's assignment persists in EmployeeSchedules table, no double-booking created
Admin A is notified of conflict and sees current state after refresh
Data integrity is maintained through conflict detection
Conflict event is logged with both administrator IDs and timestamp

edgeCases.title: Verify system performance with maximum employee assignments (500 employees)
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
System has exactly 500 active employees in the database (performance threshold)
All 500 employees are assigned to various shifts across a 4-week period
Schedule management page is configured to display monthly view
Performance monitoring tools are active to measure load times

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page and select 'Monthly View' to display all 500 employee assignments
steps.expectedResult: Page loads within 3 seconds (acceptable performance threshold), calendar renders with all 500 assignments visible, no browser freezing or lag

steps.action: Use search functionality to filter employees by typing 'Smith' in search bar
steps.expectedResult: Search results filter in real-time (under 500ms response), matching employees are displayed, calendar updates to show only filtered assignments

steps.action: Attempt to add one more assignment (501st) by assigning an available employee to a new shift
steps.expectedResult: Assignment is created successfully, system handles 501 assignments without performance degradation, save operation completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Click 'Export Schedule' button to generate report of all 500+ assignments
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates with progress indicator, CSV/PDF file generates within 10 seconds containing all assignment data accurately

postconditions: System maintains acceptable performance with 500+ assignments as per requirements
All 501 assignments are accurately stored in EmployeeSchedules table
Administrator remains on schedule management page with full functionality available
Performance metrics are logged showing load times within acceptable thresholds

edgeCases.title: Verify schedule management with employee names containing special characters and Unicode
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
System contains employees with special character names: 'O'Brien', 'José García', '李明', 'Müller-Schmidt', 'Владимир'
Schedule management page supports UTF-8 encoding
Database is configured to handle Unicode characters properly

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page and locate employees with special characters in the available employees list
steps.expectedResult: All employee names display correctly with proper character rendering: O'Brien (apostrophe), José García (accented characters), 李明 (Chinese characters), Müller-Schmidt (umlaut and hyphen), Владимир (Cyrillic)

steps.action: Search for employee 'José García' using the search bar by typing the exact name with accent
steps.expectedResult: Search successfully finds and highlights 'José García', accent is recognized correctly in search algorithm

steps.action: Assign '李明' to Monday Morning Shift by dragging from employee list to calendar slot
steps.expectedResult: Assignment is created successfully, Chinese characters display correctly in calendar slot, no character encoding errors

steps.action: Save the schedule and verify the assignment persists by refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saves successfully, after refresh '李明' still appears correctly in assigned slot with proper character encoding

steps.action: Export schedule to PDF and verify special characters render correctly in the exported document
steps.expectedResult: PDF export completes successfully, all special characters and Unicode names render correctly in the document without corruption or replacement characters

postconditions: All employee assignments with special characters are stored correctly in EmployeeSchedules table with proper UTF-8 encoding
Character encoding is maintained across all operations: display, search, save, export
Administrator remains on schedule management page with all names displaying correctly
No data corruption or character replacement occurs in database or UI

edgeCases.title: Verify schedule management at midnight boundary and daylight saving time transitions
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
System date is set to the day before daylight saving time change (e.g., March 10, 2024 at 11:45 PM)
Shift template 'Night Shift 11PM-7AM' spans across midnight and DST transition
System timezone is set to a region that observes daylight saving time (e.g., America/New_York)

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page and select the week containing the DST transition date
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays the week correctly with DST transition date marked or indicated, time slots are displayed accurately

steps.action: Assign employee 'David Wilson' to Night Shift 11PM-7AM on the night of DST transition (March 10-11)
steps.expectedResult: Assignment is created, system correctly calculates shift duration accounting for DST (either 7 hours or 9 hours depending on spring/fall), no time calculation errors

steps.action: Save the schedule and verify the shift times are stored correctly in the database
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saves successfully, success message appears, shift times are stored with correct timezone offset in EmployeeSchedules table

steps.action: View the assignment in calendar after DST transition has occurred (system time is now in DST)
steps.expectedResult: Shift displays with correct adjusted times, employee portal shows accurate shift times in current timezone, no time discrepancies or off-by-one-hour errors

postconditions: Shift assignment correctly accounts for DST transition with accurate duration calculation
All timestamps in EmployeeSchedules table are stored in UTC or with proper timezone offset
Employee sees correct shift times in their portal regardless of DST transition
No scheduling conflicts arise from DST time adjustments

edgeCases.title: Verify schedule management with empty employee list and no available templates
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
System has zero active employees in the database (all employees terminated or no employees added yet)
System has zero shift templates created
Schedule management page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page with no employees or templates in the system
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully showing empty state message: 'No employees available. Please add employees to begin scheduling.' and 'No shift templates found. Please create templates first.'

steps.action: Verify that calendar view displays empty slots with no assignments
steps.expectedResult: Calendar renders correctly with empty time slots, no errors or broken UI elements, helpful message displays 'Get started by creating shift templates and adding employees'

steps.action: Attempt to access 'Assign Employee' functionality
steps.expectedResult: Assignment controls are disabled or show tooltip 'No employees available to assign', prevents user from attempting invalid operations

steps.action: Click on 'Create Template' link or button in the empty state message
steps.expectedResult: User is redirected to shift template creation page or modal opens to create first template, providing clear path forward

postconditions: No errors or crashes occur when viewing schedule management with empty data
Administrator is provided with clear guidance on next steps (create templates, add employees)
UI gracefully handles empty state with helpful messaging
System remains stable and functional despite lack of data

edgeCases.title: Verify rapid consecutive save operations and race condition handling
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Multiple employees are assigned to shifts with unsaved changes
Network latency is normal (not throttled)
Save button is enabled and functional

steps.action: Make 3 new employee assignments to different shifts in quick succession
steps.expectedResult: All 3 assignments appear in calendar with unsaved changes indicator, save button is enabled

steps.action: Rapidly click the 'Save Schedule' button 5 times in quick succession (within 1 second)
steps.expectedResult: System handles rapid clicks gracefully: save button becomes disabled after first click, loading indicator appears, subsequent clicks are ignored or queued

steps.action: Observe the save operation completion and check for duplicate API calls in browser network tab
steps.expectedResult: Only one POST request is sent to /api/employee-schedules, no duplicate requests, success message appears once: 'Schedule saved successfully. 3 employees assigned.'

steps.action: Verify in database that assignments were created only once, not duplicated
steps.expectedResult: EmployeeSchedules table contains exactly 3 new records, no duplicate entries, all assignments have unique IDs and correct data

postconditions: No duplicate assignments are created despite rapid save button clicks
System implements proper debouncing or request deduplication
Data integrity is maintained with single save operation
Administrator remains on schedule management page with saved schedule displayed correctly

edgeCases.title: Verify schedule display and functionality on minimum supported screen resolution (320px mobile)
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator on mobile device or browser with viewport set to 320px width
Schedule management page is responsive and supports mobile view
At least 10 employees are assigned to various shifts
Mobile-optimized UI components are implemented

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page on 320px viewport (iPhone SE size)
steps.expectedResult: Page loads and adapts to mobile layout: calendar switches to list or day view, navigation is accessible via hamburger menu, no horizontal scrolling required

steps.action: Attempt to view weekly schedule on mobile view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays in mobile-optimized format (vertical list or swipeable day cards), all employee assignments are readable, text is not truncated or overlapping

steps.action: Attempt to assign an employee to a shift using touch interface
steps.expectedResult: Assignment interface is touch-friendly: buttons are at least 44px touch targets, dropdowns are accessible, drag-and-drop is replaced with tap-to-assign or modal selection

steps.action: Save the schedule using mobile interface
steps.expectedResult: Save button is accessible and properly sized, save operation completes successfully, success message is visible and readable on small screen

postconditions: Schedule management functionality is fully accessible on 320px mobile viewport
All assignments are saved correctly regardless of screen size
Administrator can perform all critical tasks on mobile device
UI remains usable and readable without layout breaking or content overflow

accessibility.title: Verify complete keyboard navigation through schedule management interface
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Schedule management page is loaded with calendar view and employee list visible
At least 5 employees are available for assignment
Keyboard focus indicators are enabled in browser
No mouse or pointing device is used during test

steps.action: Press Tab key repeatedly to navigate through all interactive elements on the page starting from the top
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves in logical order: main navigation → page heading → template dropdown → employee list → calendar grid → save button. Focus indicator is clearly visible (2px solid outline) on each element

steps.action: Navigate to the shift template dropdown using Tab, then press Enter or Space to open dropdown, use Arrow keys to select a template, press Enter to confirm
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown opens on Enter/Space, Arrow Up/Down navigate through template options, selected template is highlighted, Enter confirms selection and closes dropdown, focus returns to dropdown trigger

steps.action: Tab to employee list, use Arrow keys to navigate through employee names, press Enter on an employee to select for assignment
steps.expectedResult: Arrow keys move focus through employee list items, selected employee is highlighted with visual indicator, Enter key selects employee and opens assignment modal or activates assignment mode

steps.action: Navigate to calendar grid using Tab, use Arrow keys to move between time slots, press Enter to assign selected employee to focused slot
steps.expectedResult: Calendar grid is keyboard accessible, Arrow keys navigate between days and time slots, focused slot has clear visual indicator, Enter key assigns employee to slot, confirmation message is announced

steps.action: Press Tab to navigate to 'Save Schedule' button and press Enter to save
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves to Save button with visible indicator, Enter key triggers save operation, success message appears and receives focus for screen reader announcement

steps.action: Press Shift+Tab to navigate backwards through the interface
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves in reverse order through all interactive elements, no focus traps encountered, user can navigate back to any previous element

postconditions: All functionality is accessible via keyboard without requiring mouse
Focus order is logical and follows visual layout
No keyboard traps prevent user from navigating away from any element
Schedule assignment is successfully saved using only keyboard input

accessibility.title: Verify screen reader compatibility and ARIA announcements for schedule management
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Screen reader is active (NVDA, JAWS, or VoiceOver)
Schedule management page is loaded
At least 3 employees are assigned to shifts
ARIA live regions are implemented for dynamic content updates

steps.action: Navigate to schedule management page and listen to screen reader announcement of page title and main content
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'Employee Schedule Management, main region. Calendar view showing week of [date]. 3 employees assigned.' Page structure with landmarks (navigation, main, complementary) is announced

steps.action: Navigate to shift template dropdown and activate it, listen to screen reader announcements
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'Shift template, combo box, collapsed' then 'Shift template, expanded, 5 options available. Morning Shift 8AM-4PM, 1 of 5' as user navigates through options

steps.action: Navigate through employee list and listen to how each employee is announced
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces each employee with relevant info: 'John Smith, available, button' or 'Jane Doe, assigned to Morning Shift Monday, button'. Status and assignment info is included in announcement

steps.action: Assign an employee to a shift and listen for dynamic update announcement
steps.expectedResult: ARIA live region announces: 'John Smith assigned to Monday Morning Shift 8AM-4PM. Unsaved changes.' User is informed of action result without focus change

steps.action: Navigate to calendar grid and listen to how time slots and assignments are announced
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces: 'Monday, 8AM to 4PM, Morning Shift, assigned to John Smith, button' for filled slots, and 'Tuesday, 8AM to 4PM, Morning Shift, empty, button' for empty slots

steps.action: Save schedule and listen to success message announcement
steps.expectedResult: ARIA live region announces: 'Success: Schedule saved successfully. 3 employees assigned.' Message is announced immediately without requiring focus change

steps.action: Trigger a validation error (attempt double-booking) and listen to error announcement
steps.expectedResult: ARIA live region announces: 'Error: Cannot assign John Smith. Employee has overlapping shift from 8AM to 4PM.' Error is announced assertively with clear description

postconditions: All interactive elements have appropriate ARIA labels and roles
Dynamic content updates are announced via ARIA live regions
Screen reader users can understand page structure and complete all tasks
Error messages and success confirmations are announced clearly

accessibility.title: Verify focus management and focus trap handling in assignment modals
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Schedule management page is loaded
Assignment modal functionality is available (triggered by clicking assign button)
Keyboard navigation is being used exclusively

steps.action: Use keyboard to navigate to an empty shift slot and press Enter to open assignment modal
steps.expectedResult: Modal opens and focus automatically moves to first interactive element in modal (employee search field or first employee in list), background content is inert (not focusable)

steps.action: Press Tab repeatedly to cycle through all interactive elements within the modal
steps.expectedResult: Focus cycles through: search field → employee list items → assign button → cancel button → back to search field. Focus remains trapped within modal, cannot Tab to background content

steps.action: Press Escape key while modal is open
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes immediately, focus returns to the shift slot button that triggered the modal, user can continue navigating from that point

steps.action: Reopen modal, select an employee, and press Enter on 'Assign' button
steps.expectedResult: Assignment is completed, modal closes, focus returns to the shift slot (now showing assigned employee), success message is announced via ARIA live region

steps.action: Open modal again and press Tab until reaching 'Cancel' button, press Enter
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes without making changes, focus returns to original trigger element (shift slot button), no assignment is made

postconditions: Focus is properly managed when modal opens and closes
Focus trap prevents keyboard users from accessing background content while modal is open
Escape key provides consistent way to close modal
Focus returns to logical element after modal closes, maintaining user's place in navigation

accessibility.title: Verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards throughout schedule interface
preconditions: User is logged in as Administrator
Schedule management page is fully loaded with calendar and assignments visible
Color contrast checking tool is available (browser extension or DevTools)

userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:
Managing employee schedules effectively is crucial for ensuring that all shifts are covered and that employee availability is respected. This feature allows administrators to assign employees to shifts based on the created templates.

CURRENT STATE:
Currently, shifts are assigned manually, leading to potential conflicts and inefficiencies.

DESIRED STATE:
Administrators can easily assign employees to shifts and view schedules in a user-friendly format.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:
• Assign employees to shifts using templates.
• View schedules in a calendar format.
• Make adjustments to assignments as needed.
• Employees can view their shifts in real-time.

USER INTERACTION FLOW:
1. Administrator navigates to the employee schedule management page.
2. Administrator selects a shift template.
3. Administrator assigns employees to the selected shift.
4. Administrator saves the schedule.
5. System confirms the schedule update.
6. Employees can view their assigned shifts.

TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:
• Data source: EmployeeSchedules table in the database.
• Validation rules: Ensure employees are not double-booked.
• API endpoints: POST /api/employee-schedules for assignments.
• Security: Only authorized administrators can manage schedules.
• Performance: System should handle up to 500 employee assignments without performance issues.

OUT OF SCOPE:
• Employee self-service scheduling is not included in this story.

SUCCESS METRICS:
• 95% of shifts are filled without conflicts.
acceptanceCriteria: System allows assignment of employees to shifts using templates.
System displays schedules in a calendar format for easy viewing.
Administrators can make adjustments to assignments without errors.
Employees can view their assigned shifts in real-time.
